description.narrative:
Integrated Grain Handling Project for rural communities in Uganda
The development objectives of the project are 1) to improve livelihood in rural areas in Uganda by creating employment opportunities especially for women and youth and 2) to help mitigating the problem of postharvest loss. The supporting commercial objective is to create a number of village-based, commercially viable “grain hubs” by introducing and combining Danish technologies within grain handling, storage and milling, and it will further include payment solutions for improving access to credit and finance. The project will contribute to SDG 8, especially 8.1-8.2 and 8.5 by adding value and generating income by: 1) Increasing the quality of the crop by pre-cleaning and drying the grain. 2) Better market linkage and direct sale to customers. 3) Additional value by milling the crop on site. 4)Through further cleaning- and treatment of grain, produce quality seed for planting.
